article.title: BlockChain: A distributed solution to automotive security and privacy

choices: A centralized server architecture for vehicle data.
The communication protocol used in a vehicular network.
A typical data flow diagram for a smart vehicle.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main takeaway from Figure 2?
choices: Bitcoin BC is faster than LSB for validating new blocks.
LSB shows significantly faster processing times for validating new blocks as compared to Bitcoin BC.
The number of blocks doesn\'t impact the processing time for validation.
Both Bitcoin BC and LSB have similar processing times for validating new blocks.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 3 illustrate about the Overlay Block Manager (OBM)?
choices: It depicts the process of a vehicle connecting to a new OBM.
It showcases the data storage and retrieval mechanism in the in-vehicle storage.
It summarizes the key functions of the OBM in the LSB architecture, including transaction validation, broadcasting, and block creation.
It explains the communication flow for remote software updates.
The physical layout of a smart city with connected vehicles.
A typical architecture of a centralized cloud server system.
An overview of the decentralized overlay network, showing the interaction between OBMs, vehicles, and other entities.
The communication protocol used between the vehicle and the in-vehicle storage.
